Sentence.sentence: Thus was born the idea of the Grand Tour, a practice which introduced Englishmen, Germans, Scandinavians, and also Americans to the art and culture of France and Italy for the next 300 years.
Although calls to share data often concentrate on the moral advantages of sharing, the practice is not purely altruistic ( ' , 利他的).

What you must understand is that those supplements, especially in some eastern cultures, are part of a medical practice tradition.

But in practice, our brain discounts the risks — and benefits — associated with issues that lie some way ahead.
Yet due to poor practices in harvesting, storage and transportation, as well as market and consumer wastage, it is estimated that 30-50% of all food produced never reaches a human stomach.

In mature, fully developed countries such as the UK, more-efficient farming practices and better transport, storage and processing facilities ensure that a larger proportion of the food produced reaches markets and consumers
These should discourage retailers from wasteful practices that lead to the rejection of food on the basis of cosmetic characteristics, and losses in the home due to excessive purchasing by consumers.
Poor practices in harvesting, storage and transportation have resulted in a waste of much of the food we produce and thus a waste of land and resources
Its practice of burning forests for settlement and development.
practice asceticism in a local hermitage

Advocates of the practice have taken issue with his team's use of such evidence as news accounts to support his conclusion that goal-setting is widely over-prescribed
They resorted to unethical practice to meet their sales quota.
Studying goal-setting can throw more light on successful business practices.
The fine points of the law are decided by the courts and by acceptable common practice overtime.
I guess all those hours of practice in the past month are finally paying off.

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词都有"练习，训练，锻炼"之意。
means: drill ： 侧重进行有系统的，严格和重复的练习。
exercise ： 主要指为强壮体魄而进行的锻炼，也可指进行练习以保持已经获得的技巧。
practice ： 指把所学的理论或知识用于实践以获得技艺与技巧。
training ： 普通用词，泛指为从事某种职业而进行的身体或智力方面的训练。
discipline ： 既可指训练又可指为达到某种熟练程度而进行的约束。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含有"习惯，风俗，传统"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: habit, custom, manners, usage, practice, convention, tradition
means: habit ： 侧重于自然养成的，不易去掉的个人习惯。
custom ： 指一个国家、一个民族、一个地区或一个社会的习惯、行为方式或风俗习惯。也可指个人的习惯。
manners ： 指在某一时期或某一团体中盛行的社会礼仪或社会风俗模式。
usage ： 指持续时间长，为很多人公认采纳的惯例、习俗。
practice ： 常指习惯性的做法或行为。
convention ： 多指约定俗成的行为方式规则或公认的标准，或指艺术上公认的技巧。
tradition ： 广义指世代相传的伦理、行为规范和生活方式，特指因长久奉行而几乎具有法律效力的习惯、习俗，侧重历史意义。

stems_affixes.value_cn: 能实行的, 行得通的, 可以实行的
stems_affixes.word_buile: practice[v.实行]+able可以……的→adj.能实行的, 行得通的, 可以实行的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 实际的, 实践的, 实用的
stems_affixes.word_buile: pract实践,实际,应用+ical……的→adj.实际的, 实践的, 实用的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 实际上, 事实上, 在实践上;几乎, 简直
stems_affixes.word_buile: practical[adj.实际的, 实践的, 实用的]+ly表副词→adv.实际上, 事实上, 在实践上;几乎, 简直
pract实践,实际,应用+ise表动词→[美]v.实行;实践

word_mean: 实践，实习：用一个人的知识从事某个职业，如行医就是运用医学知识对疾病进行诊断和治疗

Sentence.sentence: A cat's mom also brings home things to her children to help them practice hunting.
Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语全国卷2 听力 原文

Sentence.sentence: A kind of "green thinking " has become part of practices.
Sentence.come: 2014年高考英语全国卷2 阅读理解 阅读B 原文

Sentence.sentence: Although the drills are used in deliberate practice might not be the most enjoyable, they might be the most relevant to improving performance.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语上海卷 阅读理解 阅读表达 原文

Sentence.sentence: And the good morning Britain presenter says she's been able to put a lot of what she's learnt into practice in her own home, preparing meals for sons, Sam, 14, finn, 13.
Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语全国卷I 阅读理解 阅读B 原文

Sentence.sentence: Deliberate practice activities require effort, produce no immediate rewards, and are motivated by the goal of improving performance rather than the goal of enjoyment.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语上海卷 阅读理解 阅读表达 原文

Sentence.sentence: Experts say it's an invaluable social practice that results in big benefits.
Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语全国卷2 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: For example, the backhand skills in tennis could be learned and improved over time by playing matches or by creating fun practice situations.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语上海卷 阅读理解 阅读表达 原文

Sentence.sentence: From that day on, Cathy kept swimming and didn't miss a single practice.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语天津卷 完形填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: I carried my football everywhere for practice.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语全国卷3 完形填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: I soon noticed it wasn't a talent thing; it was practice.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语天津卷 阅读理解 阅读E 原文

Sentence.sentence: If children often participate in deliberate play or deliberate practice activities, they are more likely to participate in sports during adulthood.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语上海卷 阅读理解 阅读表达 题设

Sentence.sentence: In contrast to deliberate play, deliberate practice is aimed at improving perfomance.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语上海卷 阅读理解 阅读表达 题设

Sentence.sentence: In contrast, when individuals are involved in deliberate practice, they exhibit behavior focused on improving performance by the most effective means available.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语上海卷 阅读理解 阅读表达 原文

Sentence.sentence: It was a tradition for the school's old team to play against the new team at the end of spring practice.
Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语天津卷 完形填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: It's called apple day but in practice it's more like apple month.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语全国卷3 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: On the other hand, Ericsson(1993) suggests that the most effective learning occurs through involvement in highly structured activities defined as deliberate practice.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语上海卷 阅读理解 阅读表达 原文

Sentence.sentence: Practice more in order to make small talk easier.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语安徽卷 任务型读写 原文

Sentence.sentence: Relearning the art of seeing the world around us is quite simple, although it takes practice and requires breaking some bad habits.
Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语天津卷 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: Six months after suffering our defeat on the spring practice field, we won our first game and our second, and continued to improve.

Sentence.sentence: Talking to someone you don't know is not the easiest thing to do! some experts say with more practice, small talk does get easier.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语安徽卷 任务型读写 原文

Sentence.sentence: The fact that such practices remain officially unaccepted reflects how far we haven't come as a society from the days when we expected every full-time worker to be supported by a full-time homemaker.

Sentence.sentence: Turning up at school for practice hours before anyone else had to be there.

sentences.cn: 这样他们就能更好地把理论运用到实践中去。

sentences.cn: 我想他们不是真的背离传统习惯。

jx.jx_en_mean: in reality (used to refer to what actually happens as opposed to what is meant or believed to happen)
jx.jx_cn_mean: 实际上（用来指与预期或据信已发生的事相反的实际情况）

lj.lj_ly: in theory this method is ideal—in practice it is unrealistic.
lj.lj_ls: 理论上这种方法很理想，——但实际上却不现实。

jx.jx_en_mean: not currently proficient in a particular activity or skill though not having exercised or performed it for some time

lj.lj_ly: he was out of practice at interrogation.

jx.jx_en_mean: used to convey that regular exercise of an activity or skill is the way to become proficient in it, especially when encouraging someone to persist in it

entry.def: You can refer to something that people do regularly as a practice .

example.ex: Some firms have cut workers' pay below the level set in their contract, a practice that is illegal in Germany...
example.tran: 一些公司把工人薪水减至低于合同规定的水平，这种做法在德国是非法的。

example.ex: Gordon Brown has demanded a public inquiry into bank practices.
example.tran: 戈登·布朗已要求对银行的惯例做法进行公开调查。

entry.def: Practice means doing something regularly in order to be able to do it better. A practice is one of these periods of doing something.

example.ex: She was taking all three of her daughters to basketball practice every day...
example.tran: 她每天都带3个女儿进行篮球训练。

example.ex: ...the hard practice necessary to develop from a learner to an accomplished musician...
example.tran: 从初学者成长为有造诣的音乐家所必需的艰苦训练

entry.def: The work done by doctors and lawyers is referred to as the practice of medicine and law. People's religious activities are referred to as the practice of a religion.
entry.tran: （医生或律师的）业务活动，工作；宗教活动

example.ex: I eventually realized I had to change my attitude toward medical practice.
example.tran: 我终于认识到自己不得不改变对医务工作的看法。

entry.def: A doctor's or lawyer's practice is his or her business, often shared with other doctors or lawyers.

example.ex: The new doctor's practice was miles away from where I lived...
example.tran: 新开的诊所离我住的地方有几英里远。

example.ex: My law practice isn't the most important thing in my life, you know.
example.tran: 你知道，我的律师事务所不是我生活里最重要的事情。

entry.def: What happens in practice is what actually happens, in contrast to what is supposed to happen.

example.ex: ...the difference between foreign policy as presented to the public and foreign policy in actual practice...
example.tran: 公布于众的外交政策和实际外交政策的区别

example.ex: In practice, workers do not work to satisfy their needs.
example.tran: 事实上，工人工作并不是为了满足本身的需要。

entry.def: If something such as a procedure is normal practice or standard practice, it is the usual thing that is done in a particular situation.

example.ex: It is normal practice not to reveal details of a patient's condition...
example.tran: 不透露患者病情的细节是惯常的做法。

example.ex: The transcript is full of codewords, which is standard practice in any army.
example.tran: 抄本上全是密码，这种做法是所有军队的惯例。

entry.def: If you are out of practice at doing something, you have not had much experience of it recently, although you used to do it a lot or be quite good at it.

example.ex: 'How's your German?' — 'Not bad, but I'm out of practice.'
example.tran: “你的德语如何？”——“还行，只是长时间没练习了。”

entry.def: If you say 'practice makes perfect ', you mean that it is possible to learn something or develop a skill if you practise enough. People often say this to encourage someone to keep practising.
If you put a belief or method into practice, you behave or act in accordance with it.

example.ex: Now that he is back, the prime minister has another chance to put his new ideas into practice...
example.tran: 既然首相又掌权了，他就重新有机会实施他的新想法。

example.ex: We weren't allowed to put into practice in our daily lives the teachings we received.
example.tran: 我们不能够将所受的教义在日常生活中付诸实践。

means.word_mean: 1. a customary way of operation or behavior;

sentences.sentence: "it is their practice to give annual raises"
"a hard theory to put into practice"
"differences between theory and praxis of communism"
"I took over his practice when he retired"

means.word_mean: 5. knowledge of how something is usually done;

sentences.sentence: "it is not the local practice to wear shorts to dinner"
"use care when going down the stairs"

means.word_mean: 3. carry out or practice; as of jobs and professions;

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from practise, on the pattern of pairs such as advise, advice
